name: Path T Hypopharynx T
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  If there is fixation of hemilarynx or larynx, assign T3.

**Note 2:** For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category (T1, T2 or T3) based on the tumor size.

    Invasive tumor confined to one of the following subsites:
       Laryngopharynx
       Postcricoid area
       Posterior pharyngeal wall
       Pyriform sinus

    Tumor invades more than one subsite of hypopharynx WITHOUT fixation of hemilarynx

    Oropharynx
    Larynx WITHOUT fixation

    Confined to hypopharynx
    Localized,  NOS
footnotes: *T4 is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use "Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles" as T4.
rows:
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not stated or unknown
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not documented in patient record
Surgical resection of primary tumor done, size is part of the T definition and the size is not available but information states that the tumor is confined to the primary
Tumor limited to one subsite of hypopharynx and/or 2 cm or less in greatest dimension

Tumor invades more than one subsite of hypopharynx or an adjacent site, OR
Measures more than 2 cm but not more than 4 cm in greatest dimension, WITHOUT fixation of hemilarynx

Tumor more than 4 cm in greatest dimension, OR 
WITH fixation of hemilarynx or extension to esophagus

Fixation of hemilarynx or larynx

Stated as T3

Note: T4 has subcategories of T4a and T4b. Assign T4 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories.

Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles

Stated as T4[NOS]

Tumor invades any of the following:
    Thyroid/cricoid cartilage
    Hyoid bone
    Thyroid gland
    Esophagus
    Central compartment soft tissue

Central compartment soft tissues of neck including:
    Prelaryngeal strap muscles

Stated as T4a

Tumor invades: 
    Prevertebral fascia
    Encases carotid artery
    Mediastinal structures

Carotid artery (encased)

Base of tongue
Floor of mouth
Nasopharynx

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4b
Pathologic T is not defined for the specific site/histology

No pathologic evaluation of primary tumor
No surgical resection of primary tumor and there isn't a positive biopsy of the highest T
Only positive biopsy of tumor which is not the highest T 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
